Name: Collecting and reporting data related to access of individuals aged 16 through 24 to public assistance as head of household.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to collecting and reporting data related to access of individuals aged sixteen through twenty-four to public assistance as head of household.

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Amendment Proposed by Comm
This Introduction was Amended by Committee
A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Committee approved by Roll Call.
A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
This Introduction was Sent to Mayor by Council
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Mayor
This Introduction was Signed Into Law by Mayor
This Introduction was Recved from Mayor by Council

\v0\par
\ul Be it enacted by the Council as follows\ulnone :\par
 \par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1 Section 1.  Chapter 1 of title 21 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new section 21-134 to read as follows:\par
\ul\'a721-134 Cash assistance application and caseload engagement status reports for individuals aged sixteen through twenty-four.\par
 a. Definitions. For the purposes of this section the following terms shall have the following meanings:\par
(1)\tab   \ldblquote BEGIN\rdblquote  shall mean the New York city department of social services/human resources administration program, known as begin employment gain independence now, which collaborates with education and training providers to offer a coordinated program of employment preparation to support the efforts of public assistance recipients who are making the transition to employment; \par
(2)\tab  \ldblquote Engageable\rdblquote  shall mean an individual is required to participate in employment, programs or activities in order to receive public assistance;\par
(3)\tab   \ldblquote Head of household\rdblquote  shall mean the member of the applicant household designated by the household to represent the household in all matters pertaining to its eligibility for and receipt of various forms of public assistance;\par
(4)\tab   \ldblquote Household\rdblquote  shall mean a single individual or family, including couples without dependent children who, or which, are eligible to receive public assistance;\par
(5)\tab   \ldblquote Public assistance\rdblquote  shall mean safety net assistance and family assistance provided by the New York city department of social services/human resources administration;\par
(6)\tab  \ldblquote Unengageable\rdblquote  shall mean an individual is exempt from having to participate in employment, programs or activities as a condition of receiving public assistance;\par
(7)\tab   \ldblquote WeCARE\rdblquote  shall mean the New York city department of social services/human resources administration program, known as wellness comprehensive assessment rehabilitation and employment, which addresses the needs of public assistance recipients with medical and/or mental health barriers to employment by providing customized assistance and services to help them achieve their highest levels of self-sufficiency; and\par
(8)\tab   \ldblquote WEP\rdblquote  shall mean the New York city department of social services/human resources administration program, known as the work experience program, which is designed to provide a simulated work experience to individuals receiving public assistance.\par
b. Cash assistance caseload engagement status report for heads of household aged sixteen through twenty-four. Beginning no later than April 1, 2013, and no later than the first day of each subsequent month, the department shall post on its website an updated report regarding the engagement status of heads of household between and including the ages of sixteen and twenty-four, that includes, at a minimum, the following information disaggregated by the following categories: 1) individuals aged sixteen and seventeen; 2) individuals aged eighteen through twenty; and 3) individuals aged twenty-one through twenty-four, calculated both as an actual number and the percentage each such number represents of the overall cash assistance caseload:\par
A.\tab  Total number of recipients of public assistance who self-report as lacking a high school degree or the equivalent at the time of application.\par
B.\tab  Total number of recipients of public assistance exempt from engagement and reason for exemption, including but not limited to: \par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi1800\sl480\slmult1 (a) \tab Total indefinitely unengagable, disaggregated by:\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi2160\sl480\slmult1 (i)  \tab head of household on supplemental social security income or other disability-based income;\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi-180\li2340\sl480\slmult1 (ii)  \tab HIV/AIDS services administration case; and\par
(iii)  \tab child only case (ages 17 and under).\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi1800\sl480\slmult1 (b) \tab Total temporarily unengageable, disaggregated by:\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi-180\li2340\sl480\slmult1 (i)  \tab temporarily incapacitated due to health situation; \par
(ii)  \tab child under 3 months of age; \par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi2160\sl480\slmult1 (iii)  \tab supplemental security income or other disability-based income pending or appealing; \par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi-180\li2340\sl480\slmult1 (iv)  \tab temporarily exempt; and\par
(v)  \tab pending WeCARE scheduling/outcome.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1 C.\tab  Total number of engageable recipients of public assistance, including but not limited to:\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi1080\sl480\slmult1 (1) \tab Total engaged in:\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi1800\sl480\slmult1 (a) \tab Employment:\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi-180\li2340\sl480\slmult1 (i)  \tab budgeted;\par
(ii)  \tab not budgeted: no aid to continue;\par
(iii)  \tab grant diversion; and\par
(iv)  \tab wage subsidy.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi1800\sl480\slmult1 (b) \tab WEP:\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi-180\li2340\sl480\slmult1 (i)  \tab WEP basic;\par
(ii)  \tab WEP medical limitations/WeCARE;\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi2160\sl480\slmult1 (iii)  \tab WEP and BEGIN managed activities, or any substantially similar successor program;\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi-180\li2340\sl480\slmult1 (iv)  \tab WEP special;\par
(v)  \tab WEP and job skills;\par
(vi)  \tab WEP and substance abuse treatment;\par
(vii)  \tab WEP/substance abuse /job search;\par
(viii)  \tab WEP/substance abuse/training;\par
(ix)  \tab WEP/WeCARE concurrent activity; and\par
(x)  \tab WEP and training.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi1800\sl480\slmult1 (c) \tab Other work activity.\par
(d) \tab Substance abuse residential treatment.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi1080\sl480\slmult1 (2) \tab Total engaged in other participation, including but not limited to: \par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi1800\sl480\slmult1 (a) \tab education/training;\par
(b) \tab job search under 12 weeks; \par
(c) \tab job search 12 weeks or more;\par
(d) \tab student over age 15;\par
(e) \tab substance abuse treatment;\par
(f) \tab substance abuse/job search;\par
(g) \tab substance abuse/training;\par
(h) \tab wellness/rehab/WeCARE;\par
(i) \tab WeCARE and substance abuse; \par
(j) \tab WeCARE vocational rehabilitation;\par
(k) \tab WeCARE concurrent activity; and\par
(l) \tab needed at home.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1 D.\tab  Total number of recipients in engagement process, disaggregated by:\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi1800\sl480\slmult1 (a) \tab call-in appointment scheduled;\par
(b) \tab eligibility call-in appointment scheduled;\par
(c) \tab WeCARE assessment scheduled; and\par
(d) \tab in review process.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1 E.\tab  Total number of recipients in a sanction process, disaggregated by: \par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi1800\sl480\slmult1 (a) \tab in conciliation;\par
(b) \tab awaiting conciliation scheduling; and\par
(c) \tab taking part in a fair hearing:\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi-180\li2340\sl480\slmult1 (i)  \tab contesting; and\par
(ii)  \tab not contesting.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1 F.\tab  Total number of recipients with a sanction in effect.\par
c. Semiannual report for heads of household aged sixteen through twenty.  Within sixty days after June 30, 2013, and within sixty days following each six month period thereafter, the department shall post on its website a report regarding the total number of individuals aged sixteen through twenty who applied for public assistance as head of household during the previous six months and of those, the total number accepted and rejected, disaggregated by the following categories: 1) individuals aged sixteen and seventeen; and 2) individuals aged eighteen through twenty.  For purposes of this subdivision, each six month period shall be deemed to end on June 30 and December 31 of each calendar year.  \par
\ulnone\'a72.  This local law shall take effect immediately. \par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar LS #2601 & LS #2656\par
JMG/ASP\par
10/3/2012\par
